Walgreens

Store Manager

November 2005 until April 2018

As a Walgreens Store Manager, I was responsible for the total operations of a Walgreens Drug Store.

There are a number of accomplishments I am proud of during my time as a Store Manager. First, a number of the employees I hired or developed over the years were subsequently promoted to Store Manager themselves. Secondly, under my leadership, my most recent store advanced to among the top 3 Walgreens stores in Utah in both sales and profit out of a total of 40+ stores. Most recently, when a CVS location was built literally across the street from our location, not only did their presence not harm our sales or customer base, they were forced out of 24-hour pharmacy status only three months after opening. Our prescription count increased subsequent to their arrival on our corner.

Walgreens

Executive Store Manager

June 2003 until November 2005

During my time as an Executive Assistant Manager, I worked at several locations and learned the trade in great detail. I earned a PTCB certification as a pharmacy technician during this time of my career. I also conducted my first applicant interviews, onboarded new employees, and started learning the basics of human resources, scheduling, and employee development.

My proudest achievement during this period of my career was that I could be relied upon to "rebuild" stores that had gotten behind on operational details. Beyond just doing the heavy lifting to clean these stores up, the primary achievement was in upskilling staff to keep up with operational demands.
